Module com.slinky.hackmaster
Package com.slinky.hackmaster.view

Class InfiniteCurveCanvas

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas
com.slinky.hackmaster.view.InfiniteCurveCanvas
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class InfiniteCurveCanvas extends javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas
The InfiniteCurveCanvas class is a custom implementation of the Canvas component that animates the drawing of the Hilbert Curve, a type of space-filling curve. This animation is intended to be displayed when the user wins the game.

This class leverages the AnimationTimer to incrementally draw the curve over time, creating a smooth and continuous visual effect. The curve is rendered in green on a black background, and each new iteration of the curve increases in order, resulting in a more complex pattern.

To use this class, instantiate it with the desired width and height, and then call startAnimation() to begin the animation. The animation can be paused or stopped with stopAnimation().

This class also supports resetting the animation to start from the beginning when the current curve completes.

Author:
Kheagen Haskins

    Methods inherited from interface javafx.css.Styleable

    getStyleableNode

  • Constructor Details

    • InfiniteCurveCanvas

      public InfiniteCurveCanvas(int width, int height)
      Constructs an InfiniteCurveCanvas with the specified width and height. Initialises the canvas, prepares the GraphicsContext for drawing, and sets up the animation timer.
      Parameters:
      width - the width of the canvas in pixels
      height - the height of the canvas in pixels

  • Method Details

    • drawNext

      public void drawNext()
      Draws the next line segment of the Hilbert Curve on the canvas. This method advances the cursor to the next point in the points array and draws a line connecting the previous point to the current point.

      If the end of the curve is reached, the canvas is reset and the order of the curve is increased, starting a new iteration with a more complex curve.

    • startAnimation

      public void startAnimation()
      Starts the animation of the Hilbert Curve. The AnimationTimer begins invoking the drawNext() method to render the curve incrementally.

    • stopAnimation

      public void stopAnimation()
      Stops the animation of the Hilbert Curve. The AnimationTimer is paused, halting the incremental rendering of the curve.
